qas.question: What was another name for the Boxers?
When did the Boxers begin to kill missionaries and Chinese Christians?

answers.text: A coalition of European, Japanese, and Russian armies

qas.question: Where did Cixi go after Beijing fell to the 8 armies?

context: Widespread drought in <a0_0>North China<a0_0/>, combined with the imperialist designs of European powers and the instability of the Qing government, created conditions that led to the emergence of the <a1_0>Righteous and Harmonious Fists<a1_0/>, or "Boxers." In <a2_0>1900<a2_0/>, local groups of Boxers proclaiming support for the Qing dynasty murdered foreign missionaries and large numbers of Chinese Christians, then converged on Beijing to besiege the Foreign Legation Quarter. <a3_0>A coalition of European, Japanese, and Russian armies<a3_0/> (the Eight-Nation Alliance) then entered China without diplomatic notice, much less permission. Cixi declared war on all of these nations, only to lose control of Beijing after a short, but hard-fought campaign. She fled to <a4_0>Xi'an<a4_0/>. The victorious allies drew up scores of demands on the Qing government, including compensation for their expenses in invading China and execution of complicit officials.
